image.altText: Victoria Police logo

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan announces a series of measures to crack down on the state's childcare sector to improve "check and balances" on care staff.

title.children: Second man charged after Melbourne childcare worker accused of 70 offences

image.altText: A street with cars and buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Morwell has played host to Erin Patterson's murder trial for the past nine weeks. Here's what it's been like in the regional Victorian town.

title.children: When the world is watching one town and its courtroom, what happens?

props.synopsis: Quake, sonic boom or something extraterrestrial? Experts are so far unable to determine the source of a short, loud sound that shook homes and startled residents in north-west Victoria.

title.children: Big bang theories abound as mystery blast rattles north-west Victoria

image.altText: Commissioner Travis Lovett at the Walk for Truth.

props.synopsis: After more than four years and over 1,300 submissions, Australia's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry has handed down its final report, calling for major reform.

title.children: 'This was a genocide': Key takeaways from Australia's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: A dry paddock through a wire fence.

props.synopsis: Parts of south-west and western Victoria have been experiencing their lowest rainfall since 1900 and climatologists say recent downpours won't be enough to end the drought.

title.children: What will it take to break the drought in Victoria?

image.altText: A young, bearded man with ginger hair smiles while standing on a country property.

props.synopsis: Adam Sutton had just collected his six-year-old son from his first day of school when they were involved in collision with Peter Agius, 23, in Gippsland in 2023.

title.children: Driver who killed young dad denies Snapchat distraction, court hears

image.altText: A photo of Erin Patterson looking distressed.

props.synopsis: As a jury considers its verdicts in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial, here's a recap of some of the evidence put before them.

title.children: As the jury retires, here's the evidence heard in Erin Patterson's trial

image.altText: Dean Hurlston sits in front of a computer displaying a Victorian Ombudsman report.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled that the head of ratepayer organisation Council Watch had stalked and harassed an inner-city Melbourne mayor under the guise of legitimate political discourse.

title.children: Council Watch head hit with intervention order over 'vile' comments

image.altText: A man stands behind a storyboard and in front of a large mural

props.synopsis: Descendants of some of the 1,053 Australian men who died in a WWII disaster say they are glad the story of the Montevideo Maru is becoming better known.

title.children: Striking memorial honours victims of wartime friendly fire tragedy

image.altText: A yellow flag that says "open home" flying off a yellow real estate sign advertising an auction.

props.synopsis: Cotality's monthly index shows national prices climbing to a fresh peak in June, as interest rate cuts drove a broad-based upswing across Australia's property markets.

title.children: Record highs for home prices as rate cuts expected to fuel more growth

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black raincoat with glasses, holds her toddler daughter, in front of swings and a playground.

props.synopsis: After Victorian mother Elysha Clarke's petition for fencing around her local playground was rejected, she wants the council to build an all-abilities space to keep neurodivergent children safe.

title.children: Mother calls for inclusive playground after daughter's near-accident

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and in a gray jumper sitting a school photo shoot.

props.synopsis: A school principal accused of child sexual abuse was shuffled onto a series of new jobs, correspondence shows.

title.children: Documents show Victoria's education department ignored complaints about 'psychopathic rapist' principal

image.altText: Three young people are leaning on a fence with farmland behind them.

props.synopsis: A program that offers students paid work and training on farms to help with workforce shortages is due to have its funding expire next year, but participants say it has been invaluable.

title.children: Teens embrace mud, cold and 3am starts for unique gap year on dairy farm

image.altText: Tom Lynch strikes Jordon Butts in the head

props.synopsis: Richmond star Tom Lynch is facing the prospect of a lengthy ban after his strike on Jordon Butts earned him a direct ticket to the AFL Tribunal.

title.children: Tom Lynch sent directly to AFL Tribunal for wild strike on opponent

image.altText: Close up photo of a young woman

props.synopsis: A Victorian court has heard that a woman who was set on fire during an arson attack in Shepparton believes the world now sees her as "something less than human".

title.children: Woman believes world sees her as 'less than human' after arson attack

image.altText: Mobile Intensive Care Ambulance (MICA) unit drives on a road in Geelong

props.synopsis: Leaked Ambulance Victoria communications reveal a struggle to fill shifts for highly trained intensive care paramedics in the Geelong region, with the union warning the agency's issues have reached "crisis level".

title.children: Dropped shifts for paramedics in Geelong region 'putting lives at risk'

image.altText: Woman in the pool, on the edge of the wall with forearms on pool floor, smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A free swimming program is tackling a long-standing issue of higher drowning rates among Victoria's overseas-born residents.

title.children: Free swimming lessons aim to reduce drownings in multicultural communities

image.altText: Someone sitting in front of a bank of computer screens, their shirt says "Shuffle" on the back

props.synopsis: Online casino Shuffle's executives are gambling on its own live broadcasts, despite it being banned in Australia.

title.children: A multi-million-dollar online lottery is bending Australia's laws

image.altText: Abel Selaocoe performing with the Australian Chamber Orchestra, seated onstage with his cello.

props.synopsis: Classical music sometimes has a reputation for being 'pale, male and stale.' A new generation of musicians is broadening our understanding of what classical music can be.

title.children: How a new generation is invigorating classical music

image.altText: Michael Voss walking across Adelaide Oval.

props.synopsis: Carlton president Rob Priestley says the club will make a "calm and rational" decision on who coaches the side beyond 2025 after a disappointing season.

title.children: Carlton boss declares Voss safe for 2025, won't guarantee anything beyond

image.altText: GettyImages-2222406691

props.synopsis: Fremantle coach Justin Longmuir says the safety of players is at risk at the SCG, as the AFL brings in experts to look into the dangerous turf.

title.children: 'It was unsafe': Coach weighs in on SCG surface as AFL looks at moving games

image.altText: A woman stand while holding a photo of herself and her husband in a photo frame.

props.synopsis: Heather Hughes' husband fought toxic fires for decades. But when he died of cancer WorkSafe rejected her dependency claim, despite recognising it as an occupational illness.

title.children: Mick died of cancer but his family's compensation claim was rejected

image.altText: A group of rugby league captains assemble before a trophy

props.synopsis: With two new teams joining the league, the NRLW has doubled in size in just over three years. Can the bigger competition be better?

title.children: Ahead of its biggest season yet, the NRLW is walking a fine balance

image.altText: smiling bald man holding dog

props.synopsis: Alexander Marinis, from Victoria, has been laid to rest and remembered as an intelligent and talented man. His identity puzzled Queensland detectives for more than a year after his body was found in the Maroochy River.

title.children: Man whose body was found in river identified after 14-month global search

image.altText: An aerial shot of a burnt out house, with two brick chimneys still standing among trees and vehicles parked in the background.

props.synopsis: Police are calling for information about an incident that left a 68-year-old man seriously injured and destroyed his home in the north-east Victorian town of Yea last week.

title.children: Burglars who bashed man, burnt down home may have got the wrong address

image.altText: A mock up of a train on the Suburban Rail Loop

props.synopsis: Suburban Rail Loop Authority transport planners have calculated how much faster people will be able to between various destinations along the SRL East between Box Hill and Cheltenham, which is scheduled to open in 2035.

title.children: Suburban Rail Loop may shave up to 40 minutes from travel times in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Two men on a sofa smile at each as one bottle feeds a baby on his lap.

props.synopsis: With more Australians finding surrogate mothers overseas, parents and lawyers are calling for an overhaul of Australia's "patchwork" laws, while some ethicists say paying for babies should remain illegal.

title.children: Couples weigh commercial baby-making amid surrogacy laws review

image.altText: man holding new suitcase

props.synopsis: The circular economy is flourishing as Australians upcycle and even sell the unsellable at op shops and second-hand dealers.

title.children: Learning to repurpose, resell and recycle is a win for purses and planet

image.altText: Penshurst Pub 2025-06-19 10:06:00

props.synopsis: The country town of Penshurst once had six pubs. Now, locals are scrambling to save their last remaining watering hole.

title.children: Victorian community rallies to buy town's last remaining pub

image.altText: Two large pine trees beside a red brick hotel in a small town main street.

props.synopsis: Anxious about the number of people posting CCTV images of attempted break-ins on social media, one beachside community has banded together to keep each other safe.

title.children: Neighbourhood Watch groups on the rise as residents try to combat crime

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: Four people in orange high vis tops, blue pants and hard hats walk along a raised concrete walkway inside a concrete tunnel.

props.synopsis: A state government frontbencher has retreated from initial denials that the Metro Rail Tunnel won't be fully operational until 2026.

title.children: Victorian Government concedes Metro Tunnel opening details still uncertain

image.altText: A close up image of Tony Burke in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Immigration Minister Tony Burke says High Court-ordered revisions have made the preventative detention regime unworkable and he is instead focused on paying countries to take members of the NZYQ migrant cohort.

title.children: Burke concedes preventative detention laws for migrants have failed

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to a dozen families who say their sons have been subjected to, or groomed to inflict, violent punishments in an alleged decades-old cycle of torment at the Victorian boarding school.

title.children: Parents hire lawyers over alleged abuse at prestigious Ballarat Grammar
